intro: Atylosia cinerea, commonly known as silverleaf coneflower, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Atylosia cinerea thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to xeriscaped gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a valuable plant for ecological and ornamental purposes.
